byline.original: By J. DAVID GOODMAN and LIZ GOOCH
byline.contributor: J. David Goodman reported from New York, and Liz Gooch from Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia.

abstract: Rev Boon Lin Ngeo, Malaysian Protestant pastor who is gay, is pushing message of tolerance for homosexuals in his home country, where fear of condemnation has kept many gay men and lesbians surviving in shadows of their conservative majority Muslim society.
snippet: With a wedding and in his writing, the Rev. Boon Lin Ngeo is trying to push the boundaries of what is acceptable in a conservative, majority Muslim country.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships

lead_paragraph: With a wedding and in his writing, the Rev. Boon Lin Ngeo is trying to push the boundaries of what is acceptable in a conservative, majority Muslim country.

headline.main: Gay Pastor in New York Urges Change in Malaysia
headline.print_headline: Gay Pastor in New York Urges Change in Malaysia
headline.seo: Boon Lin Ngeo, Gay Pastor in New York, Urges Change in Malaysia
